details:
Multiple vulnerabilities were found in tiff, a library and tools
providing support for the Tag Image File Format (TIFF).


* [CVE-2023-2908](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-2908)
NULL pointer dereference in tif\_dir.c
* [CVE-2023-3316](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-3316)
NULL pointer dereference in TIFFClose()
* [CVE-2023-3618](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-3618)
Buffer overflow in tiffcrop
* [CVE-2023-25433](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-25433)
Buffer overflow in tiffcrop
* [CVE-2023-26965](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-26965)
Use after free in tiffcrop
* [CVE-2023-26966](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-26966)
Buffer overflow in uv\_encode()
* [CVE-2023-40745](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-40745)
Integer overflow in tiffcp
* [CVE-2023-41175](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-41175)
Integer overflow in raw2tiff


For Debian 10 buster, these problems have been fixed in version
4.1.0+git191117-2~deb10u8.


We recommend that you upgrade your tiff packages.


For the detailed security status of tiff please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/tiff>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
